input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

update DNS record in Infoblox appliance. Supported DNS Records are A,PTR,CNAME,SRV,TXT and MX.
The elements under <query> element are used to locate the 'record' to be updated. If multiple matching 'record' are found, then all those are updated. Elements under <update> element are desired updated value of respective fields.
sample item.xml for type A record:
<items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <record-type>A</record-type> <query> <a-name>admin.demo.com</a-name> <ip-address>10.0.0.0</ip-address> <dns-view>default</dns-view> </query> <update> <scheduled-at>2012-12-07T16:30:19+05:30</scheduled-at> <a-name>admin.demo.com</a-name> <ip-address>10.0.0.0</ip-address> <dns-view>default</dns-view> <comment>updated comment</comment> <disable>true</disable> <ttl>120</ttl> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Site</key> <value>sample site</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </update> </parameters> </item> </items>

Elements' Description:
target[Conditional]: host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to connect Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64 Default value: Plain
timeout-secs[Optional] Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the attempt to connect to the Infoblox Grid Manager fails. Default value in seconds: 60
Note: If no adapter configurations are specified while configuring the adapter dynamic target need to be defined under "target" tag.
record-type[Required] Type of DNS record type , valid values : A,PTR,CNAME,SRV,TXT,MX
Description of elements under <query> element:
dns-view[Optional ] The DNS view where record is located. By default, record will be searched in all DNS view.
a-name[Conditional] name of the host in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) . Required if DNS object of type A is specified as record-type.
ip-address[Conditional] The IPv4 address. Required to uniquely identify A record, if multiple object of type A with same a-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional
ptrd-name[Conditional] ptrdname is the domain name of the DNS PTR record. (It is 'Domain Name' filed in the infoblox UI) Required if DNS object of type PTR is specified as record-type.
ptr-name[Conditional] hostname to which PTR record to point (It is 'Name' filed in the infoblox UI).Required to uniquely identify A record ,if multiple object of type PTR with same ptr-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional
cname-name [Conditional] This is Alias for CNAME record, A name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. The FQDN consists of the hostname followed by the domain name (example: abc.com). ex: 1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa Required if DNS object of type CNAME is specified as record-type.
srv-name[Conditional] A srv name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name). ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) . Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type.
srv-port[Conditional] The port of the SRV record ex: 10. Required to uniquely identify SRV record, if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
srv-priority[Conditional] The priority of the SRV record ex:11 . Required to uniquely identify SRV record, if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
srv-weight[Conditional] The weight of the SRV record ex:11. Required to uniquely identify SRV record, if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
srv-target[Conditional] The canonical domain name of the host (not an alias); for example, admin.demo.com (where demo.com is forward-mapping zone ) , Required to uniquely identify SRV record ,if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
txt-name[Conditional] Host name / TXT record name in string format. Required if DNS object of type TXT is specified as record-type.
txt-string[Conditional] The text of the TXT record. Required to uniquely identify TXT record ,if multiple object of type TXT with same txt-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
mx-domain-name[Conditional] A domain name in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format. Required if DNS object of type MX is specified as record-type.
mx-preference[Conditional] The preference value of the DNS shared MX object. Required to uniquely identify MX record, if multiple object of type MX with same mx-domain-name is present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
mx-exchanger[Conditional] The name of the mail exchanger in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format. Required to uniquely identify MX record, if multiple object of type MX with same mx-domain-name are present in infoblox. Otherwise it’s optional.
Description of elements under <update> element: Update: The elements under <update> tag contain values for fields being updated.
dns-view[Optional ] The DNS view where record is located.
comment[ttl] Time to Live (TTL) value. Integer that represents the duration in seconds
comment[optional] A comment in string format. Default is empty
disable[Optional ] disable flag of a DNS record Valid values true, false .
extensible-attributes[optional] Specify the extensible attributes for the record. E.g. Site, site etc.
a-name[Optional] Name of the host in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) .
ip-address[Optional] The IPv4 address associated with A record.
ptr-name[Optional] Hostname to which PTR record to point (It is 'Name' filed in the infoblox UI).
ipv4-address[Optional] IPv4 address of the DNS PTR record. Note: If you want to modify domain name of the DNS PTR record, use ipv4-address. (This is infoblox API limitation that one can not directly update the domain name of PTR record instead has to use the ip address)
ipv6-address[Optional] IPv6 address of the DNS PTR record. Note: If you want to modify domain name of the DNS PTR record, use ipv6-address. (This is infoblox API limitation that one can not directly update the domain name of PTR record instead has to use the ip address)
cname-name [Optional] This is Alias for CNAME record, a name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. The FQDN consists of the hostname followed by the domain name (example: abc.com). Ex: 1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa
canonical-name [Conditional] The complete canonical (or official) name of the host.
srv-name[Optional] A name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name). Ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone).
srv-port[Optional] The port of the SRV record ex: 10.
srv-priority[Optional] The priority of the SRV record ex:11 .
srv-weight[Optional] The weight of the SRV record ex:11.
srv-target[Optional] The canonical domain name of the host (not an alias); for example, admin.demo.com (where demo.com is forward-mapping zone),
txt-name[Optional] Host name / TXT record name in string format.
txt-string[Conditional] The text of the TXT record.
mx-domain-name[Optional] A domain name in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format.
mx-preference[Optional] The preference value of the DNS shared MX object.
mx-exchanger[Optional] The name of the mail exchanger in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format.
scheduled-at[Optional] Specify the date time on which operation need to be executed. Date and time are represented in ISO 8601 extended format (e.g., 2008-10-21T10:56:00Z or 2008-10-21T10:56:00.001Z) with some restrictions. When the scheduling parameter is used, changes do not occur immediately. Instead at the date time specified in this parameter.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.

documentation.description: This wrapper updates a DNS record of type A,PTR,SRV,MX,CNAME and TXT.
